p: Human metapneumovirus is a single-stranded RNA paramyxovirus of worldwide endemicity that causes respiratory tract infection in children, the elderly, and immunocompromised adults, with outbreaks reported in long-term care facilities [ 86â€“ 90]. Infection occurs in the late winter and early spring (January through April), similar to the seasonality of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV). Upper and lower respiratory tract symptoms, including rhinorrhea, sore throat, cough, dyspnea, and fever, have been described.
